page.title: 15THE MARKET SQUARE,HARLOW.
page.content: There has been a{market square}in the town for about{25}years.Most stalls are set up 4 days a week (Tues.Thurs. Fri.Sat.)to sell clothes,jewellery, fruit/veg.,records and make-up. They take about two to four hours each time to assemble. Most of the shoppers say they prefer the market because there is more variety and it is cheaper. Most travel to the market by car or motorbike. Many people would like improvements: changing rooms in the clothes stalls; more variety of stalls;wider choice of clothes;fully covered walkways. Some trade has been lost since the {Harvey Centre}was opened in{1982}and a few stallholders have taken their trade elsewhere. About eight of the original stalls from the 1960s are still there.
